text: Blue indicator on the main machine is flashing and pressure looks low; run the low-pressure diagnostic and confirm sensor readings.
Red alarm light on the main machine is active; clear the alarm by performing the standard reset.
Machine is idle and needs to be started up from a powered-off or ready state.
Machine must be safely shut down from running state for maintenance.
Temperature warning: red overheat light is on; check temperature sensor and trigger cooling override.
Cycle jam indicator is blinking; clear the jam with the standard cycle-clear procedure.
Motor fault light is on; reset the motor and verify current sensor is normal.
Calibration prompt yellow light is on; run sensor calibration mode on the machine.
Machine vibration warning is triggered; read vibration sensor, run diagnostics, and report if still abnormal.
Silent alert LED is blinking even though audible alarm is off; perform silent alert reset.
Main machine is completely unresponsive to button presses; perform a full power cycle and try starting again.
Purple diagnostic light is flashing; machine should be switched into diagnostic mode.
Machine is stuck in diagnostic mode and won’t return to normal operation; exit diagnostic mode using the proper hold sequence.
Cooling fan speed warning is active; check fan speed sensor and boost fan speed if low.
Security lockout has been triggered on the machine; reset the lockout and operate the safety lever.
Alignment indicator is blinking; run the automatic alignment validation on the machine.
System heartbeat/status LED is off; wake up the system and wait for heartbeat to resume.
Low flow rate error is displayed; check the flow sensor and perform a flow reset.
Operator requested a full test of all panel buttons on the machine.
Main lever on the machine feels stuck or sluggish; attempt to free the lever and report if still jammed.
A cube on Table 1 needs to be relocated into the machine’s tray area for processing.
A cylinder has fallen to the floor; it should be picked up and returned to Table 1.
Several balls are scattered on Table 1; gather them and place them into the ball basket.
An unknown or foreign object is sitting on Table 1; remove it and put it in the disposal bin.
Blocks on Table 1 are mixed; sort them by size into the appropriate zones.
The machine needs a tool that is currently on Table 1; deliver the tool to the machine’s side shelf.
Operator wants Table 1 cleared completely of all objects and items stored away.
A marker is required at the machine console but is currently on Table 1; retrieve it and place it by the console.
A heavy block on Table 1 is in the wrong location and must be moved safely to the floor zone.
Cylinders on Table 1 are lying randomly; orient them upright and align them along the alignment strip.
A parts box on Table 1 is needed next to the machine; transport it to the tool shelf near the machine.
Loose nuts are scattered near Table 1; collect them and drop them into the designated parts cup.
A spare motor cover is currently on Table 1 and should be stored back on the storage rack.
A cleaning cloth is needed at the machine, but it is on Table 1; move it to the side hook near the machine.
Mixed metallic and plastic items are on Table 1; separate them into metal and plastic bins.
An item on Table 1 needs to be picked up and placed on the machine’s inspection pad for inspection.
A box is blocking the edge of Table 1 and should be moved toward the back area of the table.
A ball is on Table 1 but belongs on Table 2; transfer it to the center of Table 2.
The machine needs a cylinder component that is currently on Table 1; bring it and place it near the machine slot.
Loose items on Table 1 must be picked and placed into the sorting tray for later processing.
Tools are scattered across Table 2; sort them by type and place them into the tool bin.
A box is sitting in the wrong spot on Table 2; move it to the designated back corner.
A screwdriver is needed at the machine but currently lies on Table 2; retrieve it and put it on the machine shelf.
Small parts on Table 2 are unorganized; sort them into two separate parts trays.
A ball is found on Table 2 and should be placed into the ball basket.
Extra or unneeded items are on Table 2; remove them and place them in the storage box.
A marker is lying on Table 2; it should be stored inside the marker holder.
Boxes on Table 2 are misaligned; reposition them into a straight line along the alignment edge.
A cylinder is on Table 2 but should be on Table 1; move it to the drop zone on Table 1.
Loose screws are scattered on Table 2; gather them and drop them into the screw cup.
A cleaning brush is required at the machine; it is currently on Table 2 and needs to be brought to the machine side hook.
An unknown foreign item is sitting on Table 2; remove it and place it into the disposal bin.
Cylinders of different colors on Table 2 need to be separated into red and blue zones.
Small boxes on Table 2 should be stacked neatly on top of each other.
A specific part needed by the operator is on Table 2; deliver that part to the operator pad by the machine.
A heavy object on Table 2 must be safely relocated to a floor zone.
An item on Table 2 has been requested for inspection; place it onto the inspection pad.
A tool lying on Table 2 needs to be returned to the wall-mounted tool rack.
Items on Table 2 must be arranged neatly in rows according to the row layout.
A box on Table 2 must be transferred to Table 1 and placed in the center area.
The machine requires a reset that uses a screwdriver from Table 1 to operate the reset screw port.
A machine panel is loose; use a wrench from Table 2 to tighten the panel and then return the tool.
The machine won’t proceed until a cylinder from Table 1 is placed in the loading slot and the confirm button is pressed.
The machine intake cover is missing and is stored on Table 2; retrieve it and mount it on the intake port.
Labeling is required at the machine, and a marker from Table 2 must be brought to the label station.
Lubrication is required on the machine; the lube bottle on Table 1 needs to be delivered and placed near the maintenance port.
The machine’s output tray is full of parts; clear them and move them to the sorting area at Table 2.
Before starting a cycle, the machine needs a cube from Table 1 and a cylinder from Table 2 placed into slots A and B, followed by a cycle start.
A defective part is reported at the machine; remove it and send it to the reject bin on Table 1.
The machine area needs wiping and the cleaning cloth is currently on Table 1; bring it to the machine side hook.
A tool that belongs on Table 2 is currently at the machine; return it to Table 2.
The machine is overheating and the cooling fan is inactive; bring the cooling tool from Table 1 to the fan area and press cooling override.
Operator wants a status check on the machine, followed by moving a box from Table 2 into a staging area.
The machine operator needs small parts arranged near the machine; gather them from Table 2 to the side shelf.
Machine’s light guard is missing and is stored on Table 1; retrieve and reattach it to the designated fixture.
A test cycle requires a specific test object from Table 2 to be inserted into a test slot and the test button pressed.
An alarm is active because an item is jammed in the machine; remove the jammed object to Table 1’s inspection bin and then reset the alarm.
The machine reports a missing component which is located on Table 1; retrieve and insert it into the component slot.
The machine requires a cube from Table 1 and a rod from Table 2 placed into slots A and B before pressing confirm.
Operator wants the machine put into prep mode and then wants Table 1 cleared with items put into a storage bin.
A cycle that uses both tables requires a cube from Table 1 and a cylinder from Table 2 loaded into the machine before starting.
An alarm is active but the cause depends on the color of the alarm light; handle red, yellow, and blue lights differently using the standard rules.
Operator requests parts delivered in order: first part A from Table 1 then part B from Table 2, staged on the machine shelf and marked ready.
Items on Table 2 must be sorted and then the machine’s diagnostic panel read afterward.
Both Table 1 and Table 2 are cluttered; perform cross-station cleanup by moving all items into the storage bin.
The machine wants an item inspected: move it from the machine to the inspection pad on Table 1, then react based on a green or red signal.
Machine is stuck mid-cycle and requires a complex reset: stop, power off, retrieve alignment tool from Table 2, use it, then power on and restart.
Before restarting the machine, empty the output tray and store items from Table 1, then trigger restart on the machine.
Machine shows an error code; depending on which code appears, either fetch a part from Table 1, run diagnostics, or notify a technician.
A large part must be staged on a staging table and then moved again into the machine mount in a two-stage delivery.
System reset requires pressing reset on two different panels at the machine, then confirming lights are off.
An assembly operation needs a base plate from Table 2 and a top piece from Table 1 combined near the machine, then the assemble button pressed.
An alert is active and the workspace around Table 2 is messy; acknowledge the alert, clean the table into a bin, then restart the machine.
Machine won’t start unless the lever is in the down position; check lever position, adjust if needed, and then start the machine.
Which table to use depends on the indicator color: green means fetch a green item from Table 1, blue from Table 2, and place it into the correct machine slot.
A timed prep is needed: place a prep item from Table 1 on the machine pad, wait, then press prep followed by start.
Multiple objects from Table 2 need to be moved one-by-one onto the inspection pad for inspection.
Machine requests a tool-assisted reset: press the initial reset, fetch a special tool from Table 2, use it at the reset port, then press final reset.
Machine shows both red and green lights; for red you must reset, and for green you must fetch an item from Table 1 and place it into a green slot.
Machine has entered safe mode; acknowledge the emergency, install a safety blocker from Table 1 into the safety port, then initiate the restart sequence.
